Estimate accuracy metrics to evaluate point forecast

Source: R/error_metrics.R
error_metrics.Rd

This function estimates several accuracy metrics to evaluate the accuracy of point forecasts. Either along the forecast horizon or along the train-test-splits. By default, the following accuracy metrics are provided:

  • ME: mean error

  • MAE: mean absolute error

  • MSE: mean squared error

  • RMSE: root mean squared error

  • MAPE: mean absolute percentage error

  • sMAPE: scaled mean absolute percentage error

  • MPE: mean percentage error

  • MASE: mean absolute scaled error

error_metrics(fcst, test, train = NULL, period = NULL, by = "split")

Arguments

fcst

A fable containing the forecasts for the models, splits, etc.
test

A tsibble containing the testing data.
train

A tsibble containing the training data. If train = NULL, no MASE is calculated.
period

Integer value. The period used for the estimation of the in-sample MAE of seasonal naive forecast. The in-sample MAE is required for scaling the MASE.
by

Character value. Either accuracy is estimated by split or horizon.

Value

A tibble containing the accuracy metrics for all key variables and models.

Contents
